name: graph_neighborhood_maintenance
chinese_name: 浅谈一类图上邻域相关问题
author: 焦思源
complexity: O(n + m + q * ρ_max(G)) time, O(m √m) space for block method (in specific extensions)
summary: The paper discusses efficient methods for maintaining and querying neighborhood-related information in graphs. It introduces a technique based on graph density and vertex deletion order to direct edges, enabling each node to maintain only incoming edge contributions. This leads to an O(n + m + qρ_max(G)) online solution, where ρ_max(G) is the maximum density of any subgraph. The method outperforms traditional sqrt-decomposition on sparse graphs and extends to more complex queries like range neighborhood updates and path counting via sequence transformation and block-based or Mo's algorithm techniques.
